Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text, writing on recto only (12 ll.), verso blank. Dated year 1 of Harmakhis. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Tender by Harsiese son of Thotortais to the priests of Hathor of Gebelen to act as scribe of the cattle in the temple for one year".
Curator's comments: Published by M.-P. Chaufray and W. Wegner, in S.L. Lippert, M. Schentuleit and M.A. Stadler (eds), 'Sapientia Felicitas: Festschrift fuer Guenter Vittmann zum 29. Februar 2016' (CENIM 14; Montpellier, 2016), pp. 23-49. Text 1 in Shore's Manuscript Catalogue of Demotic Gebelein Papyri in the British Museum.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (620) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/620)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: loss, fractured, insect attack Black ink Tabbed: kraft paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: kraft paper Binding: self adhesive linen tape Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair
